citations.narrative:
In at least thirteen enclosures, mothers or foster females were housed with juveniles greater than 6 months of age. These
pairs were either in a single enclosure providing 4.33 square feet of space or a group of two adults with either 1 or 2
juveniles greater than 6 months of age in a double enclosure with 8.66 square feet of space. Each juvenile macaque over
6 months of age requires an additional 3 square feet of space according to the table referenced in 3.80(b)(1) (mothers
with infants less than 6 months of age may be maintained together in primary enclosures that meet the floor space and
height requirements for the mother). Innovative enclosures may be utilized with approval by the IACUC under 3.80(c)
when additional volume of space is provided even if floor space does not precisely meet the floor area and height
requirements. Primary enclosures housing more than one nonhuman primate must meet minimum space requirements for
the sum of the minimum floor space required for each individual nonhuman primate per the table.
Correct by 14 February 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the manager and Attending Veterinarian.
n

narrative:
3.80(b)(4) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
In at least thirteen enclosures, mothers or foster females were housed with juveniles greater than 6 months of age. These 
pairs were either in a single enclosure providing 4.33 square feet of space or a group of two adults with either 1 or 2 
juveniles greater than 6 months of age in a double enclosure with 8.66 square feet of space. Each juvenile macaque over 
6 months of age requires an additional 3 square feet of space according to the table referenced in 3.80(b)(1) (mothers 
with infants less than 6 months of age may be maintained together in primary enclosures that meet the floor space and 
height requirements for the mother). Innovative enclosures may be utilized with approval by the IACUC under 3.80(c) 
when additional volume of space is provided even if floor space does not precisely meet the floor area and height 
requirements. Primary enclosures housing more than one nonhuman primate must meet minimum space requirements for 
the sum of the minimum floor space required for each individual nonhuman primate per the table. 
 
Correct by 14 February 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the manager and Attending Veterinarian.
